titleStmt.title: SalTEI: TEI Customization
titleStmt.author: generated by Roma 4.18, David Glück, Andreas Wagner, Ingo Caesar

publicationStmt.p: For use by whoever wants it.

sourceDesc.p: born digital, created on Wednesday 19th March 2014

change.p: Withdraw removal of att.global.change; add element space (module transcr); add values "#AA" (automatic annotation), "#CRC" and "#DG" to @resp.
Add value "unknown" to unclear/@reason, div/@type, and milestone/@unit; add values "#right" and "#gap" to @rendition.
Add XInclude elements.
Remove @style and @rend from att.global.rendition class and add hi @rendition value for "recte".
remove value "sub" of title@type; date@type="summaryFirstEd|summaryThisEd", remove "summary".
Added title@type=245a, ref@type=catLink,institution, date@type=summary

listChange.change: Allow text@xml:id to be VolXY (with a capital 'V') instead of volXY, so as to match how the xml files are actually called.
specified dictionary and analysis elements replaced exclude- with include-specifications in some moduleRef instances made @status an optional attribute in revisionDesc

change.p: Relaxes a few parts (keeping this more in synch with the author schema).

list.item: Reactivated attribute deletions in att.classes removals
added required xml:id attributes in certain elements
replace @who with @resp in definitions of responsibilty (gap, supplied etc.)
use tei_odd schema for this odd file

change.p:
Modifications to cater for Editorial Guidelines (in W_Head_general.xml):
remove "#code" from hi@rendition - use code instead, once we have the tagdocs module.
allow ref type="image"

Modifications to cater for Editorial Guidelines (in W_Head_general.xml):
add "#code" to hi@rendition
add tagdocs module
clear up classspec definitiones which are used to delete the whole class of attributes anyway
add "#l-ident" to hi@rendition values
cope with damage/del and gap/unclear/supplied elements
narrow down and explain docStatus values (and remove the revisionStmt element from att.docStatus so that it does not need to have a status itself).
extend text types to cover lemma-/author articles and working papers
add gaiji module.
consolidate @types of text and div elements.
remove category/taxonomy elements since we won't be using them.
change list and ref elements to use summaries/summary respectively.
add "monograph" to possible values of text@type.
text@type is only optional. (and whitespace formatting.)
Synched partly with http://dfg-viewer.de/strukturdatenset/, this concerns specific types of div and text tags.
Also allowed biblscope tag as it is used in seriesStmt.

Removed @synch (it means sync in time, for speech transcription)and defined list@rendition values (like dta does as per www.deutsches-textarchiv.de/doku/basisformat_texterschliessung_formal#Klammerungen. Changed @status to an xml name data type (without '/'). Also re-shuffled *Spec-entries to sort on @ident.

body.p: for more information.TEI customization for primary source texts established by the project "The School of Salamanca" of the Academy of Sciences and of Literature, Mainz, Germany. Contact info.salamanca@adwmainz.de for more information.info.salamanca@adwmainz.de for more information.TEI customization for primary source texts established by the project "The School of Salamanca" of the Academy of Sciences and of Literature, Mainz, Germany. Contact info.salamanca@adwmainz.de for more information.

valItem.desc: Hyphenation, correction and abbr. expansion suggestions.
Hyphenation, correction and abbr. expansion suggestions approved and implemented.
Enrichment (entity annotation, linking, etc.) in process.
Enrichment approved, work publicly and persistently released.
Further corrections/enrichment done, pending four-eye cross-check.
Final version for archival of project results.

attDef.desc: Key that identifies the referenced work in the project's web application.
Schlüssel, über den die Zitation in der Webapp identifiziert wird.

valItem.desc: A part of a document that has been splitted for technical reasons.

valItem.gloss: grouping brace, pointing to the left
grouping brace, pointing to the right

attDef.desc: The @facs attribute contains a pointer or link to the file representing the image scan of the page that is beginning here. Since we are using private URI schemes, this has to begin with a "facs" prefix. Next comes the work number, volume identifier and (four-digit) page number (and no extension). The prefix is separated with a colon (":") from the rest, whereas work number, volume identifier and page number are separated with dashes ("-"). A complete example: "facs:W0001-A-0228" (Page 228 of the first volume of work W0001).

valItem.desc: A part of a document that has been splitted for technical reasons.
A snippet with recent news of the project.
A document needed for technical reasons, schema, doc etc.

attDef.desc: Only to use in the TEI-header. (classifies the title according to some convenient typology).
Use: required in the TEI-header. (classifies the title according to some convenient typology).
Only to use in the body. provides an externally-defined means of identifying the entity (or entities) being named, using an URI.
Only to use in the body. provides an externally-defined means of identifying the entity (or entities) being named, using a coded value of some kind.
